earthquakeSafety.title: Actions at Home
earthquakeSafety.subtitle: Click here to view precautions for actions at home
precautions: Take cover under a sturdy table or desk
Stay away from windows and heavy furniture
Secure tall furniture and appliances to walls

earthquakeSafety.title: Safe Places in Open Areas
earthquakeSafety.subtitle: Click here to view precautions for safe places in open areas
precautions: Move to open areas away from buildings, trees, and streetlights
Protect your head and neck with your arms

earthquakeSafety.title: Safety Measures in Vehicles
earthquakeSafety.subtitle: Click here to view precautions for safety measures in vehicles
precautions: Pull over to a safe location away from overpasses, bridges, and buildings
Stay inside the vehicle until shaking stops
Avoid stopping under trees, streetlights, and utility wires

earthquakeSafety.title: First Aid Information
earthquakeSafety.subtitle: Click here to view first aid information
precautions: Check for injuries and provide first aid
If someone is unconscious, call emergency services

earthquakeSafety.title: Essential Supplies to Keep
earthquakeSafety.subtitle: Click here to view the list of essential supplies to keep
supplies: Water (1 gallon per person per day)
Important documents (ID, insurance, etc.) in a waterproof container
N95 masks for dust and debris
Moist towelettes and garbage bags for sanitation
Emergency contact list with addresses and phone numbers

earthquakeSafety.title: Emergency Plan
earthquakeSafety.subtitle: Click here to view the emergency plan
earthquakeSafety.plan: Designate meeting points, establish communication plans, and practice evacuation routes with family members. Conduct regular drills.

earthquakeSafety.title: Precautions for Pets
earthquakeSafety.subtitle: Click here to view precautions for pets
precautions: Prepare an emergency kit for each pet with food, water, and medications
Include pet toys and comfort items in their emergency kit

earthquakeSafety.title: Electrical and Gas Shutdown Procedures
earthquakeSafety.subtitle: Click here to view electrical and gas shutdown procedures
procedures: Turn off gas valves if safe to do so
Avoid using matches or lighters until gas is confirmed off
Inspect for gas leaks using a soap and water solution
Know the location of the main water and gas shutoff valves in your home
